element.name: iliohypogastric nerve
element.distribution: skin above the pubis and over the lateral side of the buttock, and occasionally the pyramidal muscle

element.name: genitofemoral nerve
element.distribution: cremaster muscle, skin of scrotum or labium majus and of adjacent area of thigh and femoral triangle

element.name: genitofemoral nerve, genital branch
element.distribution: uscular branches to cremaster; cutaneous branches to skin of scrotum and labium majus, mons pubis

element.name: genitofemoral nerve, femoral branch
element.distribution: supply skin over sheath

element.name: furcal nerves
element.synonyms: furcal nerve - forth lumbar nerve; the five pairs of nerves (L1-L5) that arise from the lumbar segments of the spinal cord, each pair leaving the VERTEBRAL COLUMN below the correspondingly numbered vertebra
element.distribution: ventral branches of these nerves participate in the formation of the lumbosacral plexus

element.name: cluneal nerves, superior
element.origin: dorsal branches of the upper lumbar nerves
element.distribution: innervating the skin of the upper part of the buttocks

element.name: splanchnic nerves, lumbar
element.branches: to descending abdominal aorta, celiac ganglion
element.distribution: upper nerves join celiac and adjacent plexuses, middle ones go to intermesenteric and adjacent plexuses, and lower ones descend to superior hypogastric plexus

element.name: femoral nerve
element.origin: lumbar PLEXUS (L2-L4); descending behind the inguinal ligament to the femoral triangle
element.branches: saphenous nerve, muscular and anterior cutaneous branches
element.distribution: skin of thigh and leg, muscles of front of thigh, and hip and knee joints; psoas major, sartorius
element.actions: flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates femur at hip

element.name: muscular branches
element.distribution: muscles of anterior compartment of thigh - sartorius, iliacus, pectiueus, vastus intermedius/lateralis/medialis, rectus femoris
element.action: flexes, abducts, and laterally rotates femur at hip; flex femur at hip; adducts and flexes femur; extend leg at knee joint

element.name: saphenous nerve
element.origin: termination of femoral nerve, descending first with femoral vessels and then on medial side of leg and foot, L3/L4
element.branches: infrapatellar and medial crural cutaneous branches
element.distribution: knee joint, subsartorial and patellar plexuses, skin on medial side of leg and foot

element.name: cutaneous nerve of thigh, intermediate
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne76.htm INTERMEDIATE CUTANEOUS NERVE OF THIGH]; intermediate femoral cutaneous nerve
element.distribution: supply the skin of front of thigh right to knee

element.name: cutaneous nerve of thigh, medial
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne77.htm MEDIAL CUTANEOUS NERVE OF THIGH]; medial femoral cutaneous nerve

element.name: cutaneous nerve of thigh, medial, anterior
element.distribution: two branches: one supplies integument as low down as medial side of knee; other crosses to lateral side of patella

element.name: cutaneous nerve of thigh, medial, posterior
element.distribution: supply integument of medial side of leg

element.name: cutaneous nerve of thigh, posterior
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne76.htm INTERMEDIATE CUTANEOUS NERVE OF THIGH]; posterior femoral cutaneous nerve
element.distribution: supply skin of posterior surface of thigh and leg, as well as skin of perineum

element.name: obturator nerve, proper
element.distribution: adductor muscles and gracilis muscle, skin of medial part of thigh, and hip and knee joints

element.name: obturator nerve, accessory
element.origin: ventral branches of ventral branches of L3-L4
element.distribution: pectineus muscle, hip joint, obturator nerve

element.name: plantar nerve, medial
element.branches: cutaneous, proper digital nerve to 1st toe, common digital nerve to 1st-2nd/2nd-3rd/3rd-4th, muscular branches to first lumbrical/abductor hallucis/flexor hallucis brevis/flexor digitorum

element.name: plantar nerve, medial, proper digital branches
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne89.htm COMMON DIGITAL BRANCHES OF MEDIAL PLANTAR NERVE]
element.distribution: 1-4 toes

element.name: plantar nerve, medial, common digital branches
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne89.htm COMMON DIGITAL BRANCHES OF MEDIAL PLANTAR NERVE]
element.distribution: 1-4 toes

element.name: nerve of quadrate muscle of thigh
element.origin: ventral branches of ventral branches of lumbar PLEXUS L4-L5
element.distribution: inferior gemellus muscle, anterior quadratus muscle of thigh, hip joint

element.name: hypogastric nerve
element.distribution: branches to testicular plexus, ovarian plexus, ureteric plexus, internal iliac plexus, sigmoid colon
